About.SmallHeading: SOHO Champagne hotel-inspired luxury condo, unit 1608
About.Heading: Soho Champagne unit 1608
About.Description1: This 16th floor premium 1 bedroom unit in SOHO Champagne hotel-inspired condo offers the best in Ottawa's urban lifestyle. The building is located in Little Italy, right on the bike path and minutes away from the O-Train Carling station, Carleton University, the Rideau Canal, beautiful Dow's Lake, tranquil Arboretum and some of the best Ottawa restaurants located along the Preston street. Combined with the unit's 9ft. floor-to-ceiling windows and 78 sq. ft. private balcony overlooking Preston street and the Dow's Lake (a guaranteed unobstructed view!), the location, the convenience and the views are truly unbeatable.
About.Description2: Price Includes 1 undeground parking & 1 storage locker. Appliances: EG Wall Oven, AEG Dishwasher, Fridge, Cook top, Panasonic Microwave, Bosch Washer and Dryer, Nest smart thermostat. Building Amenities: Dalton Brown Gym, Theatre, Terrace, Hot Tub, BBQ, Party Room, Business Center. Transit Options: Steps to O-Train and bus stop, highway nearby. Site Influences: Dow's Lake, the Rideau Canal, Highway Access, O-Train, Preston Street, Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus, Carleton University, Commissioners Park, Dominion Arboretum.

TabPanel.TabPara: The unit features an extremely popular limited edition H floor plan with a unique bedroom layout and luxury modifications (featured exclusively for the upper floors), previously completely sold out. The unit features a range of luxury components, such as full hardwood floors, 9 feet ceilings, and Gluckstein Design kitchen with white quartz countertops, glass tile backsplash and integrated appliances (AEG Wall Oven, AEG Dishwasher, Fridge, Cook top, Panasonic Microwave, Bosch Washer and Dryer). The 3-piece bathroom includes polished marble tile and a walk-in shower. One parking spot and a storage locker are included in the price.

FeaturesWrapper.FeaturesCardPara: The condo was built by Mastercraft Starwood, a leader in luxury residential development, under its SoHo brand that is known for superior design and quality features and finishes. Following the tradisiton of international collaboration with leading architects, designers and artists, the Soho Champagne luxury residence features Brian Gluckstein designed interiors, SoHo Floor-to-Ceiling & Wall-to-Wall Windows™ and SoHo Designer Kitchen™.

SOHO Champagne provides over 15,000 sq. ft. of amenity space, both indoor and outdoor. The building features a fully-equipped Dalton Brown Gym, a 25+ seat theater with state-of-the-art equipment, a party room, a lounge area, a two-storey hotel inspired lobby with marble walls and floors, a third floor landscaped outdoor terrace with hot tub, BBQ and dining area - over 15,000 sq. ft. of amenity space! A hotel-trained concierge is present on site.

Soho Champagne is located in Little Italy, one of Ottawa's finest neighbourhoods. Little Italy is steeped in history and is a great destination for both residents and visitors. It offers a range of fantastic dining options and is surrounded by park land, including Dows Lake and the National Capital Commission (NCC) trail system. Since 1975, each June the neighbourhood hosts the Italian Week festival, Ottawa's celebration of Italian culture.

AccordianCustom.title: Little Italy
AccordianCustom.description: Located across from Dow’s Lake Ottawa and known locally as “Little Italy”, the neighborhood was initially settled around 1900 by Italian immigrants and has now evolved to one of the most culture-rich quarters Ottawa has on offer. Since 1975, each June the neighbourhood hosts the Italian Week festival, Ottawa's celebration of Italian culture.

AccordianCustom.title: Dow's Lake
AccordianCustom.description: Dow's lake situated on the Rideau canal is the centre of much of the city’s recreational activities. In May, the surrounding park, Commissioners Park, displays tulips planted by the NCC (National Capital Commission) for the annual Canadian Tulip Festival. Over 50 varieties and approximately 300,000 tulips bloom each May along the Rideau Canal. During the winter, Dow's Lake freezes and becomes part of the world's longest skating rink and one of the primary sites of the Winterlude festival in February, with events such as the 'bed races' and 'waiter races' on the ice. At the north end of the lake a pavilion is situated over the water with three restaurants overlooking the water.

AccordianCustom.title: Restaurants
AccordianCustom.description: Little Italy offers one of the best varieties of dining locations in the Ottawa, ranging from an iconic Canadian diner FlapJack’s to Giovanni’s, one of the best Italian restaurants in the city.

AccordianCustom.title: Public transit and new LRT
AccordianCustom.description: The neighbourhood is located on multiple major bus routes and steps from Ottawa's Carling O Train station. Being close to the intersection of Preston Street and Carling Avenue, it provides a direct and reliable link to Bayview Station and downtown, Carleton University, and the Greenboro shopping area, while easy access to the 417 makes a drive towards either Kanata or Orleans a smooth and quick experience. A bike path, running parallel to the Preston street, offers a wonderful cycling experience, safe from the street traffic.
